title: 2 Systems of carts with different string tensions

content.question: In Figure 1, cart Y is connected to cart X by a tight string and is also connected to the hanging block of mass <math alttext="m sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> by a light string that passes over a pulley. Figure 2 shows a system that is identical except for one change: cart Y and X are connected by a spring at its equilibrium length. Both systems are released from rest. Is the hanging blockâ€™s acceleration as a function of time the same in both systems, and why or why not?

choices.label: Yes, because the net external force exerted on both systems is the same.
Yes, because the tension in the string connecting the block to cart Y is determined by the masses of cart Y and the block.
No, because the net external force exerted on each system is different.
No, because the tension in the string connected to the block is constant in one system but not in the other.

content.answer: No, because the tension in the string connected to the block is constant in one system but not in the other.
